comment: There were 2517 (2167 male, 341 female) probands in the study, 777 of whom were previously in Iossifov et al 2012, O'Roak et al 2012 and Sander et al 2012. Another 9 probands lack sex info, none of whom had a de novo, and the sex counts do not include these individuals. These counts are for the probands with IQ >= 70.
These counts are for the probands with verbal IQ and nonverbal IQ < 70, i.e. possible intellectual disability.

Supplementary table 1 lists the trio counts for each subcohort. These sum to 2270 trios in the study, 825 of which are from Iossifov et al. Neuron 2012, O'Roak et al. Nature 2012, Sanders et al. Nature 2012 and Willsey et al. 2013 (doi:10.1016/j.cell.2013.10.020), giving 1445 trios unique to this study. Supplementary table 2 contains the de novos identified in this study, which exclude the de novos from Iossifov 2012, O'Roak 2012, Sanders 2012 and Willsey 2013. We get the sex numbers from the sex ratio of probands with de novos in Supplementary table 2 (816 male, 173 female), extrapolated for the 1445 probands unique to this study.
